resources.string: Write Things you want to avoid

Lake AI Assistant uses accessibility services to provide voice-controlled device automation. This allows hands-free operation of your phone through AI-powered commands, making technology more accessible. The service reads screen content and performs actions only when actively requested by you.

string.u: Wake word not initializing? Open me!

resources.string: Allow Lake to send you notifications for important updates or messages.
This lets you activate Lake by holding the home button or using a voice command, even when the app is closed.
Uses UI structure data (faster, less resource intensive)
Uses actual screenshots (more accurate, higher resource usage)
Start a new conversation with Lake
Microphone permission required for voice input

"ü§ñ Why Lake Needs Accessibility Services:
" "Lake is an AI assistant that helps you control your phone through voice commands. To do this, it requires accessibility permissions to understand and interact with your device.

" "üì± What This Permission Allows:
" "‚Ä¢ Read Screen Content: Lake can see and analyze what's currently displayed on your screen to understand the context and provide relevant assistance.

" "‚Ä¢ Perform Actions: Execute touch gestures, taps, swipes, and navigation (Back, Home, Recent Apps) on your behalf based on your voice commands.

" "‚Ä¢ App Interaction: Open apps, fill forms, scroll through content, and navigate between different screens as requested.

" "üîí Privacy & Data Protection:
" "‚Ä¢ All processing happens on Gemini API
" "‚Ä¢ No personal data is collected or but it is sent to Google Gemini
" "‚Ä¢ Screen content is only accessed when you actively use Lake, otherwise Lake doesnt access screen content
" "‚Ä¢ We implement safeguards to protect sensitive information, but Lake can still make mistake

" "‚ôø Accessibility Benefits:
" "This service enables hands-free device control, making smartphones more accessible for users with disabilities, visual impairments, or mobility limitations.

" "By proceeding, you understand and consent to Lake using accessibility services for AI-powered device automation."

Allows Lake to see the apps you have installed. With this, Lake can open applications for you directly and instantly (e.g., "Open YouTube"), instead of relying on slower methods of searching the screen. This makes the process much faster and more reliable.
If there is too much demand, our wake word service might be down, in that case we will add button at the bottom left and you can use it to activate lake
Select your preferred default voice for text-to-speech
Natural-sounding male voice with neural technology
Natural-sounding female voice with neural technology
ü§ñ Enable Lake AI to control your phone through voice commands. This permission allows reading screen content and performing actions for hands-free device automation and improved accessibility.
The microphone is required for the voice command and wake-word features. It allows you to give instructions to Lake by speaking.
This permission is used to show visual feedback, such as the questions that lake have, captions and the voice wave animations, on top of other apps while Lake is working.

At the end of a conversation, Lake\'s AI (powered by Google\'s Gemini model) analyzes the dialogue to identify lasting facts. It\'s trained to ignore fleeting or unimportant details. For example, if you say, || remind me to call my brother Ankit tomorrow ||,the AI might create a memory like: || The user\'s brother is named Anita. ||

Once a memory is created (e.g., The user lives in Ghaziabad.), it is stored in a secure, private database directly on your phone. This database is part of the Lake app\'s internal storage and is not accessible by other apps.

ü§ñ Lake is an AI assistant that needs accessibility services to control your phone through voice commands.

This permission allows Lake to:

‚Ä¢ Read screen content to understand context
‚Ä¢ Perform touches, swipes, and navigation
‚Ä¢ Automate tasks across all apps

üîí Your privacy is Google Privacy Rule for Gemini API - Your app calls Gemini API to understand his next action.

Lake requires accessibility services to function as your AI assistant.

This enables voice-controlled automation of your device for hands-free operation and improved accessibility.

üîí All data processing occurs locally on your device for maximum privacy.

string.name: lake_not_working
string.u: Lake not working on your phone?

resources.string:
If Lake is not working properly, this might be due to intense battery optimization by your device manufacturer.

Manufacturers like Samsung, Huawei, OnePlus, Xiaomi, and others often add aggressive battery optimizations that can break Lake's functionality.

To fix this, you need to disable battery optimizations specifically for Lake in your device settings.
Get your free Picovoice API Key, you can paste it here.
Hey, accessibility permission is needed to execute any task. I know you might have doubt giving this permission to me, but my code is open source, so can always check it out if you have doubts.

string.name: get_your_free_accesskey_from_the_picovoice_console
string.u: Get your free AccessKey from the Picovoice Console

resources.string: At the end of a conversation, Panda\'s AI (powered by Google\'s Gemini model) analyzes the dialogue to identify lasting facts. It\'s trained to ignore fleeting or unimportant details. For example, if you say, remind me to call my brother Ankit tomorrow, the AI might create a memory like: The user\'s brother is named Ankit.

Once a memory is created (e.g., The user lives in Ghaziabad), it is stored in a secure, private database directly on your phone. This database is part of the Panda app\'s internal storage and is not accessible by other apps.
